thread.title: Home Front Hero

author: wsjcom
title: Home Front Hero
text:
Americans of a certain age know the story of Admiral James Stockdale, the Navy pilot who was shot down over North Vietnam and imprisoned and tortured for more than seven years. Less well known is the story of his wife, Sybil, who fought tirelessly on the home front for better treatment for POWs and who died last Saturday at age 90.
Jim Stockdale was captured in 1965 and as the senior officer at the Hanoi Hilton became a special target for North Vietnamese abuse. He disfigured himself and even slit his wrists to prevent... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
